name: E.V. Hill
description:
E.V. Hill (1933 - 2003)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker E.V. Hill in mp3 format.  Was pastor of Mt. Zion Missionary Baptist Church in Los Angeles for 42 years. Hill served as leader of the National Baptist Convention and on the board of the Billy Graham Association. He was also an influential leader in the civil rights movement. Hill passed away in 2003 at age 69. His first wife, Jane, died of cancer in 1987. Hill is survived by his second wife, La Dean, and several children and grandchildren.
On the first Sunday in 1961, Pastor Hill took charge as Pastor of the historical Mount Zion Missionary Baptist Church of Los Angeles where he remained the beloved pastor for 42 years. He was a world-renowned evangelist, much loved but often criticized for his unswerving dedication to biblical integrity.  He was considered one of the most significant preachers of the 20th century. He was greatly admired as one who marched across the boundary lines of race, religion, denomination, and political preferences.

sermons.title: The Lord Giveth
sermons.description: E.V. Hill preaches this sermon at the funeral of his wife. It is a passionate pleading exhoration to "trust God" admist the circumstances. What faith he exhibits as a living testimony during this very challanging time in his life.
